Home > external > kegg > getMetsFromKEGG.m

getMetsFromKEGG

PURPOSE

getMetsFromKEGG

SYNOPSIS

function model=getMetsFromKEGG(keggPath)

DESCRIPTION 

 getMetsFromKEGG
   Retrieves information on all metabolites stored in KEGG database

   Input:
   keggPath    if keggMets.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
               directory, this function will attempt to read data from a
               local FTP dump of the KEGG database. keggPath is the path
               to the root of this database

   Output:
   model       a model structure generated from the database. The
               following fields are filled
       id              'KEGG'
       name     'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
       mets            KEGG compound ids
       metNames        Compound name. Only the first name will be saved if
                       there are several synonyms
       metMiriams      If there is a CHEBI id available, then that will be
                       saved here
       inchis          InChI string for the metabolite
       metFormulas     The chemical composition of the metabolite. This
                       will only be loaded if there is no InChI string

   NOTE: If the file keggMets.mat is in the RAVEN\external\kegg directory
   it will be loaded instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not
   exist it will be saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you
   should remove the keggMets.mat file if you want to rebuild the model
   structure from a newer version of KEGG.
               
   Usage: model=getMetsFromKEGG(keggPath)

 NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file

 ENTRY       C00001                      Compound
 NAME        H2O;
             Water
 FORMULA     H2O
 EXACT_MASS  18.0106
 MOL_WEIGHT  18.0153
 REMARK      Same as: D00001
 REACTION    R00001 R00002 R00004 R00005 R00009 R00010 R00011 R00017
             R00022 R00024 R00025 R00026 R00028 R00036 R00041 R00044
             (list truncated)
 ENZYME      1.1.1.1         1.1.1.22        1.1.1.23        1.1.1.115
             1.1.1.132       1.1.1.136       1.1.1.170       1.1.1.186
             (list truncated)
 BRITE       Therapeutic category of drugs in Japan [BR:br08301]
             (list truncated)
 DBLINKS     CAS: 7732-18-5
             PubChem: 3303
             ChEBI: 15377
             (list truncated)

 Then a lot of info about the positions of the atoms and so on. It is not
 certain that each metabolite follows this structure exactly.

 The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
 (except for '///').

 Check if the reactions have been parsed before and saved. If so, load the
 model.

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG

0002 % getMetsFromKEGG
0003 %   Retrieves information on all metabolites stored in KEGG database
0004 %
0005 %   Input:
0006 %   keggPath    if keggMets.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
0007 %               directory, this function will attempt to read data from a
0008 %               local FTP dump of the KEGG database. keggPath is the path
0009 %               to the root of this database
0010 %
0011 %   Output:
0012 %   model       a model structure generated from the database. The
0013 %               following fields are filled
0014 %       id              'KEGG'
0015 %       name     'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
0016 %       mets            KEGG compound ids

0018 %                       there are several synonyms

0022 %       metFormulas     The chemical composition of the metabolite. This
0023 %                       will only be loaded if there is no InChI string

0025 %   NOTE: If the file keggMets.mat is in the RAVEN\external\kegg directory
0026 %   it will be loaded instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not
0027 %   exist it will be saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you
0028 %   should remove the keggMets.mat file if you want to rebuild the model
0029 %   structure from a newer version of KEGG.
0030 %
0031 %   Usage: model=getMetsFromKEGG(keggPath)

0033 % NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file
0034 %
0035 % ENTRY       C00001                      Compound
0036 % NAME        H2O;
0037 %             Water
0038 % FORMULA     H2O
0039 % EXACT_MASS  18.0106
0040 % MOL_WEIGHT  18.0153
0041 % REMARK      Same as: D00001
0042 % REACTION    R00001 R00002 R00004 R00005 R00009 R00010 R00011 R00017
0043 %             R00022 R00024 R00025 R00026 R00028 R00036 R00041 R00044
0044 %             (list truncated)
0045 % ENZYME      1.1.1.1         1.1.1.22        1.1.1.23        1.1.1.115
0046 %             1.1.1.132       1.1.1.136       1.1.1.170       1.1.1.186
0047 %             (list truncated)
0048 % BRITE       Therapeutic category of drugs in Japan [BR:br08301]
0049 %             (list truncated)
0050 % DBLINKS     CAS: 7732-18-5
0051 %             PubChem: 3303
0052 %             ChEBI: 15377
0053 %             (list truncated)
0054 %
0055 % Then a lot of info about the positions of the atoms and so on. It is not
0056 % certain that each metabolite follows this structure exactly.
0057 %
0058 % The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
0059 % (except for '///').
0060 %
0061 % Check if the reactions have been parsed before and saved. If so, load the
0062 % model.
0063 %
0064 
0065 if nargin<1
0066     keggPath='RAVEN/external/kegg';
0067 end
0068 
0069 ravenPath=findRAVENroot();
0070 metsFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggMets.mat');
0071 if exist(metsFile, 'file')
0072     fprintf(['Importing KEGG metabolites from ' strrep(metsFile,'\','/') '... ']);
0073     load(metsFile);
0074 else
0075     fprintf(['NOTE: Cannot locate ' strrep(metsFile,'\','/') ', it will therefore be generated from the local KEGG database\n']);
0076     if ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'compound'),'file') || ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'compound.inchi'),'file')
0077         EM=fprintf(['The files ''compound'' and ''compound.inchi'' cannot be located at ' strrep(keggPath,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP.\n']);
0078         dispEM(EM);
0079     else
0080         fprintf('Generating keggMets.mat file... ');
0081         %Add new functionality in the order specified in models
0082         model.id='KEGG';
0083         model.name='Automatically generated from KEGG database';
0084         
0085         %Preallocate memory for 30000 metabolites
0086         model.mets=cell(30000,1);
0087         model.metNames=cell(30000,1);
0088         model.metFormulas=cell(30000,1);
0089         model.metMiriams=cell(30000,1);
0090         
0091         %First load information on metabolite ID, metabolite name,
0092         %composition, and ChEBI
0093         
0094         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'compound'), 'r');
0095         
0096         %Keeps track of how many metabolites that have been added
0097         metCounter=0;
0098         
0099         %Loop through the file
0100         while 1
0101             %Get the next line
0102             tline = fgetl(fid);
0103             
0104             %Abort at end of file
0105             if ~ischar(tline)
0106                 break;
0107             end
0108             
0109             %Skip '///'
0110             if numel(tline)<12
0111                 continue;
0112             end
0113             
0114             %Check if it's a new reaction
0115             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENTRY       ')
0116                 metCounter=metCounter+1;
0117                 
0118                 %Add empty strings where there should be such
0119                 model.metNames{metCounter}='';
0120                 model.metFormulas{metCounter}='';
0121                 
0122                 %Add compound ID (always 6 characters)
0123                 model.mets{metCounter}=tline(13:18);
0124                 
0125                 %Add the KEGG id as metMiriams
0126                 if length(model.mets{metCounter})==6
0127                     miriamStruct=model.metMiriams{metCounter};
0128                     if strcmp('G',model.mets{metCounter}(1))
0129                         miriamStruct.name{1,1}='kegg.glycan';
0130                     else
0131                         miriamStruct.name{1,1}='kegg.compound';
0132                     end
0133                     miriamStruct.value{1,1}=tline(13:18);
0134                     model.metMiriams{metCounter}=miriamStruct;
0135                 end
0136             end
0137             
0138             %Add name
0139             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'NAME        ')
0140                 %If there are synonyms, then the last character is ';'
0141                 if strcmp(tline(end),';')
0142                     model.metNames{metCounter}=tline(13:end-1);
0143                     %Semicolon can also occur in the middle, separating
0144                     %several synonims in the same line
0145                     model.metNames{metCounter} = regexprep(model.metNames{metCounter},';.+','');
0146                 elseif regexp(tline,';')
0147                     model.metNames{metCounter}=tline(13:end);
0148                     model.metNames{metCounter} = regexprep(model.metNames{metCounter},';.+','');
0149                 else
0150                     model.metNames{metCounter}=tline(13:end);
0151                 end
0152             end
0153             
0154             %Add composition
0155             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'FORMULA     ')
0156                 model.metFormulas{metCounter}=tline(13:end);
0157             end
0158             
0159             %Add PubChem id
0160             if numel(tline)>21
0161                 if strcmp(tline(13:21),'PubChem: ')
0162                     if isstruct(model.metMiriams{metCounter})
0163                         addToIndex=numel(model.metMiriams{metCounter}.name)+1;
0164                     else
0165                         addToIndex=1;
0166                     end
0167                     miriamStruct=model.metMiriams{metCounter};
0168                     miriamStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='pubchem.substance';
0169                     miriamStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(22:end);
0170                     model.metMiriams{metCounter}=miriamStruct;
0171                 end
0172             end
0173             
0174             %Add CHEBI id
0175             if numel(tline)>19
0176                 if strcmp(tline(13:19),'ChEBI: ')
0177                     if isstruct(model.metMiriams{metCounter})
0178                         addToIndex=numel(model.metMiriams{metCounter}.name)+1;
0179                     else
0180                         addToIndex=1;
0181                     end
0182                     chebiIDs=strsplit(tline(20:end),' ');
0183                     miriamStruct=model.metMiriams{metCounter};
0184                     for i=1:numel(chebiIDs)
0185                         miriamStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='chebi';
0186                         miriamStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=strcat('CHEBI:',chebiIDs{i});
0187                         addToIndex=addToIndex+1;
0188                     end
0189                     model.metMiriams{metCounter}=miriamStruct;
0190                 end
0191             end
0192         end
0193         
0194         %Close the file
0195         fclose(fid);
0196         
0197         %If too much space was allocated, shrink the model
0198         model.mets=model.mets(1:metCounter);
0199         model.metNames=model.metNames(1:metCounter);
0200         model.metFormulas=model.metFormulas(1:metCounter);
0201         model.metMiriams=model.metMiriams(1:metCounter);
0202         
0203         %Then load the InChI strings from another file. Not all metabolites
0204         %will be present in the list
0205         
0206         inchIDs=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0207         inchis=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0208         
0209         %The format is metID*tab*string
0210         
0211         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'compound.inchi'), 'r');
0212         
0213         %Loop through the file
0214         counter=1;
0215         while 1
0216             %Get the next line
0217             tline = fgetl(fid);
0218             
0219             %Abort at end of file
0220             if ~ischar(tline)
0221                 break;
0222             end
0223             
0224             %Get the ID and the InChI
0225             inchIDs{counter}=tline(1:6);
0226             inchis{counter}=tline(14:end);
0227             counter=counter+1;
0228         end
0229         
0230         %Close the file
0231         fclose(fid);
0232         
0233         inchIDs=inchIDs(1:counter-1);
0234         inchis=inchis(1:counter-1);
0235         
0236         %Find the metabolites that had InChI strings and add them to the
0237         %model
0238         [a, b]=ismember(inchIDs,model.mets);
0239         
0240         %If there were mets with InChIs but that were not in the list
0241         if ~all(a)
0242             EM='Not all metabolites with InChI strings were found in the original list';
0243             disp(EM);
0244         end
0245         
0246         model.inchis=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0247         model.inchis(:)={''};
0248         model.inchis(b)=inchis;
0249         
0250         %Remove composition if InChI was found
0251         model.metFormulas(b)={''};
0252         
0253         %Ensuring that all model.metMiriams.value consist only of strings,
0254         %no double
0255         for i=1:(numel(model.mets))
0256             for j=1:(numel(model.metMiriams{i}))
0257                 if isa(model.metMiriams{i}.value{j},'double')
0258                     model.metMiriams{i}.value{j}=num2str(model.metMiriams{i}.value{j});
0259                 end
0260             end
0261         end
0262         
0263         %Removing fronting and trailing whitespace from metNames
0264         model.metNames = deblank(model.metNames);
0265         
0266         %Fixing redundant metNames. The first occurence of particular
0267         %metabolite name is not changed, but starting from the second
0268         %occurence, original metabolite name is concatenated with KEGG
0269         %COMPOUND id between the brackets
0270         for i=1:(numel(model.metNames))
0271             if ~isempty(model.metNames{i})
0272                 if sum(ismember(model.metNames(1:i-1),model.metNames(i)))>=1
0273                     model.metNames(i) = strcat(model.metNames(i), ' (', model.mets(i),')');
0274                 end
0275             end
0276         end
0277         %Saves the model
0278         save(metsFile,'model');
0279     end
0280 end
0281 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0282 end
